H0.text: Gases are the samples the students are studying in science class, as the teacher explains they are made of two or more minerals.

H1.text: Rocks are the samples the students are studying during science class, because they are composed of two or more minerals, as the teacher explains.

H2.text: Elements are what the students are studying when the teacher explains that the samples they are examining are made of two or more minerals.

H3.text: Molecules are what the students are studying during science class when the teacher explains that the samples they are studying are made of two or more minerals.

A4.text: Rocks are composed primarily of grains of minerals, which are crystalline solids formed from atoms chemically bonded into an orderly structure.
